Events.text: Maya king Yuknoom Yich'aak K'ahk' assumes the crown of Calakmul.
Events.html: Maya king Yuknoom Yich'aak K'ahk' assumes the crown of Calakmul.

Events.text: King Louis the Pious captures Barcelona from the Moors after a siege of several months.
Events.html: King Louis the Pious captures Barcelona from the Moors after a siege of several months.

Events.text: Edward the Confessor is crowned King of England.
Events.html: Edward the Confessor is crowned King of England.

Events.text: The first Parliament of Friuli is created.
Events.html: The first Parliament of Friuli is created.

Events.text: The Peace of Cateau-Cambrésis treaty is signed, ending the Italian Wars.
Events.html: The Peace of Cateau-Cambrésis treaty is signed, ending the Italian Wars.

Events.text: The generals in the Greek War of Independence stand trial for treason.
Events.html: The generals in the Greek War of Independence stand trial for treason.

Events.text: The first successful United States Pony Express run from St. Joseph, Missouri, to Sacramento, California, begins.
Events.html: The first successful United States Pony Express run from St. Joseph, Missouri, to Sacramento, California, begins.

Events.text: American Civil War: Union forces capture Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America.
Events.html: American Civil War: Union forces capture Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America.

Events.text: American Old West: Robert Ford kills Jesse James.
Events.html: American Old West: Robert Ford kills Jesse James.

Events.text: Gottlieb Daimler is granted a German patent for his engine design.
Events.html: Gottlieb Daimler is granted a German patent for his engine design.

Events.text: The first of eleven unsolved brutal murders of women committed in or near the impoverished Whitechapel district in the East End of London, occurs.
Events.html: The first of eleven unsolved brutal murders of women committed in or near the impoverished Whitechapel district in the East End of London, occurs.

Events.text: The trial in the libel case brought by Oscar Wilde begins, eventually resulting in his imprisonment on charges of homosexuality.
Events.html: The trial in the libel case brought by Oscar Wilde begins, eventually resulting in his imprisonment on charges of homosexuality.

Events.text: Joseph Stalin becomes the first General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Joseph Stalin becomes the first General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

links.title: General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union

Events.text: First flight over Mount Everest, a British expedition, led by the Marquis of Clydesdale, and funded by Lucy, Lady Houston.
Events.html: First flight over Mount Everest, a British expedition, led by the Marquis of Clydesdale, and funded by Lucy, Lady Houston.

Events.text: Bruno Richard Hauptmann is executed for the kidnapping and death of Charles Augustus Lindbergh, Jr., the baby son of pilot Charles Lindbergh.
Events.html: Bruno Richard Hauptmann is executed for the kidnapping and death of Charles Augustus Lindbergh, Jr., the baby son of pilot Charles Lindbergh.

Events.text: World War II: Japanese forces begin an assault on the United States and Filipino troops on the Bataan Peninsula.
Events.html: World War II: Japanese forces begin an assault on the United States and Filipino troops on the Bataan Peninsula.

Events.text: Japanese Lt. General Masaharu Homma is executed in the Philippines for leading the Bataan Death March.
Events.html: Japanese Lt. General Masaharu Homma is executed in the Philippines for leading the Bataan Death March.

Events.text: United States President Harry S. Truman signs the Marshall Plan, authorizing $5 billion in aid for 16 countries.
Events.html: United States President Harry S. Truman signs the Marshall Plan, authorizing $5 billion in aid for 16 countries.

Events.text: In Jeju Province, South Korea, a civil-war-like period of violence and human rights abuses begins, known as the Jeju uprising.
Events.html: 1948 – In Jeju Province, South Korea, a civil-war-like period of violence and human rights abuses begins, known as the Jeju uprising.

Events.text: The American Civil Liberties Union announces it will defend Allen Ginsberg's book Howl against obscenity charges.
Events.html: The American Civil Liberties Union announces it will defend Allen Ginsberg's book Howl against obscenity charges.

Events.text: Hudsonville–Standale tornado: The western half of the Lower Peninsula of Michigan is struck by a deadly F5 tornado.
Events.html: Hudsonville–Standale tornado: The western half of the Lower Peninsula of Michigan is struck by a deadly F5 tornado.

Events.text: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his "I've Been to the Mountaintop" speech.
Events.html: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his "I've Been to the Mountaintop" speech.

Events.text: Vietnam War: United States Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird announces that the United States will start to "Vietnamize" the war effort.
Events.html: Vietnam War: United States Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird announces that the United States will start to "Vietnamize" the war effort.

Events.text: Martin Cooper of Motorola makes the first handheld mobile phone call to Joel S. Engel of Bell Labs.
Events.html: Martin Cooper of Motorola makes the first handheld mobile phone call to Joel S. Engel of Bell Labs.

Events.text: The 1974 Super Outbreak occurs, the second biggest tornado outbreak in recorded history (after the 2011 Super Outbreak). The death toll is 315, with nearly 5,500 injured.
Events.html: The 1974 Super Outbreak occurs, the second biggest tornado outbreak in recorded history (after the 2011 Super Outbreak). The death toll is 315, with nearly 5,500 injured.

Events.text: Bobby Fischer refuses to play in a chess match against Anatoly Karpov, giving Karpov the title of World Champion by default.
Events.html: Bobby Fischer refuses to play in a chess match against Anatoly Karpov, giving Karpov the title of World Champion by default.

Events.text: The Osborne 1, the first successful portable computer, is unveiled at the West Coast Computer Faire in San Francisco.
Events.html: The Osborne 1, the first successful portable computer, is unveiled at the West Coast Computer Faire in San Francisco.

Events.text: Suspected "Unabomber" Theodore Kaczynski is captured at his Montana cabin in the United States.
Events.html: Suspected "Unabomber" Theodore Kaczynski is captured at his Montana cabin in the United States.

Events.text: The Thalit massacre begins in Algeria; all but one of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.
Events.html: The Thalit massacre begins in Algeria; all but one of the 53 inhabitants of Thalit are killed by guerrillas.

Events.text: United States v. Microsoft Corp.: Microsoft is ruled to have violated United States antitrust law by keeping "an oppressive thumb" on its competitors.
Events.html: United States v. Microsoft Corp.: Microsoft is ruled to have violated United States antitrust law by keeping "an oppressive thumb" on its competitors.

Events.text: Islamic terrorists involved in the 2004 Madrid train bombings are trapped by the police in their apartment and kill themselves.
Events.html: Islamic terrorists involved in the 2004 Madrid train bombings are trapped by the police in their apartment and kill themselves.

Events.text: Conventional-Train World Speed Record: A French TGV train on the LGV Est high speed line sets an official new world speed record.
Events.html: Conventional-Train World Speed Record: A French TGV train on the LGV Est high speed line sets an official new world speed record.

Events.text: ATA Airlines, once one of the ten largest U.S. passenger airlines and largest charter airline, files for bankruptcy for the second time in five years and ceases all operations.
Events.html: ATA Airlines, once one of the ten largest U.S. passenger airlines and largest charter airline, files for bankruptcy for the second time in five years and ceases all operations.

Events.text: Texas law enforcement cordons off the FLDS's YFZ Ranch. Eventually 533 women and children will be taken into state custody.
Events.html: 2008 – Texas law enforcement cordons off the FLDS's YFZ Ranch. Eventually 533 women and children will be taken into state custody.

links.title: Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints

Events.text: Jiverly Antares Wong opens fire at the American Civic Association immigration center in Binghamton, New York, killing thirteen and wounding four before committing suicide.
Events.html: Jiverly Antares Wong opens fire at the American Civic Association immigration center in Binghamton, New York, killing thirteen and wounding four before committing suicide.

Events.text: Apple Inc. released the first generation iPad, a tablet computer.
Events.html: Apple Inc. released the first generation iPad, a tablet computer.

Events.text: More than 50 people die in floods resulting from record-breaking rainfall in La Plata and Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Events.html: More than 50 people die in floods resulting from record-breaking rainfall in La Plata and Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Events.text: The Panama Papers, a leak of legal documents, reveals information on 214,488 offshore companies.
Events.html: The Panama Papers, a leak of legal documents, reveals information on 214,488 offshore companies.

Events.text: A bomb explodes in the St Petersburg metro system, killing 14 and injuring several more people.
Events.html: A bomb explodes in the St Petersburg metro system, killing 14 and injuring several more people.
